meanings.sent1: The kids were so jiggy after winning the game.
meanings.sent2: She always gets jiggy when she hears her favorite song.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tail wagged jiggy with joy.
meanings.sent4: The colorful balloons made the party decorations look jiggy.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunshine brought a jiggy feeling to the park.

meanings.sent1: They jiggyed all night at the dance party.
meanings.sent2: The crowd started to jiggy when the music began.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to jiggy their way through the dance competition.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the trees seemed to jiggy in the wind's rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they tried to jiggy to the fast beat.

meanings.sent1: She wore a jiggy dress to the fancy event.
meanings.sent2: The new sneakers are so jiggy; everyone wants a pair.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked surprisingly jiggy in its tiny bowtie.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night appeared jiggy with all the lights.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was vibrant and jiggy, catching everyone's eye.
